publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1903 Bob Doris: Jeff Torrington—That the Parliament takes aff its bunnet and bids farewell to Jeff Torrington; remembers with fondness his wonderful novel Swing Hammer Swing, which won the Whitbread Book of the Year Award in 1992; recalls the clarity of style, wickedness of humour and sureness of pen which brought Glasgow to life in all its energetic complexity, and considers that the dark moving tale of Tam Clay placed him at the top table of Scottish contemporary writers and that this remarkable contribution to Scottish literature will be forever remembered. Supported by: Stuart McMillan*, Kenneth Gibson*, Alasdair Allan*, Bill Kidd*, Bashir Ahmad*, Gil Paterson*, Tavish Scott*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Sandra White*, Robin Harper*, Christina McKelvie*, Roseanna Cunningham*
S3M-1903 Jeff Torrington (lodged on 14 May 2008) Rob Gibson*, Alex Neil*, Jamie Hepburn*
